definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To say or write (something) using particular words; to phrase (something).
examples: I’m not sure how to word this letter to the council.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , obsolete ) To flatter with words, to cajole .
( transitive ) To ply or overpower with words.
( transitive , rare ) To conjure with a word.
( intransitive , archaic ) To speak , to use words; to converse , to discourse .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To say or write (something) using particular words; to phrase (something).
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , obsolete ) To flatter with words, to cajole .
( transitive ) To ply or overpower with words.
( transitive , rare ) To conjure with a word.
( intransitive , archaic ) To speak , to use words; to converse , to discourse .

definitions.definition: Alternative form of worth ( “ to become ” ) .

main_definition: Alternative form of worth ( “ to become ” ) .
